item.title: Watch Mumbai Station's Unique New Year Tradition As Trains Honk In Synchrony - News18
item.description:
Watch Mumbai Station's Unique New Year Tradition As Trains Honk In Synchrony

Date: January 01, 2025

Source: The Times of India

The iconic Chhatrapati Shivaji Terminus (CST) station echoed with a symphony of train horns as the clock struck midnight, showcasing a unique New Year’s Eve tradition.

  • The synchronized honking tradition has become synonymous with CST station.
  • Many commuters documented the event on social media, highlighting its popularity.
  • Railway enthusiasts have coordinated this event for several years, turning it into a much-anticipated spectacle.
  • The atmosphere is filled with joy and camaraderie, celebrating unity among diverse groups.
“Sea vessels also blow their horns at full volume,” commented an observer on social media.

This heartwarming tradition not only brings joy to the commuters but also preserves the railway heritage of Mumbai.

item.title: Punjabi actor-singer Diljit Dosanjh meets PM Modi: ‘A fantastic start to 2025’ - The Indian Express
item.description:
Diljit Dosanjh Meets PM Modi: A Memorable Start to 2025

Publication Date: Wednesday
Source: Indian Express

Punjabi actor-singer Diljit Dosanjh met Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday, marking a significant interaction filled with discussions about music and culture.

  • Dosanjh described the meeting as “A fantastic start to 2025.”
  • The meeting included discussions on various topics, especially music.
  • PM Modi praised Dosanjh’s blend of talent and tradition and highlighted his journey from modest beginnings to international success.
  • Dosanjh expressed admiration for Modi’s sentiments toward his mother and the Ganga river.
“He has been winning over people,” Modi joked, referring to Diljit Dosanjh.

Overall, the meeting signifies a blend of culture and recognition for Dosanjh's contributions to music and society.

item.title: Bangladesh Army chief calls for national consensus, ‘political government’, tones down anti-India rhetoric - The Hindu
item.description:
Bangladesh Army Chief Advocates Political Consensus and Cools Anti-India Sentiments

Published: January 01, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

In a recent interview, Bangladesh Army Chief General Waker-uz-Zaman emphasized the need for national reconciliation and a political government to ensure stability in Bangladesh. He noted that both Bangladesh and India depend on each other and highlighted the importance of a peaceful environment for development.

  • The Army Chief called for the creation of a national consensus to restore tolerance among citizens.
  • General Waker-uz-Zaman criticized the current interim administration's policing failures.
  • He acknowledged the interdependence of India and Bangladesh for security and economic stability.
  • The interview followed rising tensions regarding a call to dismantle the 1972 Constitution, which met opposition even from within the political ranks.
  • General Waker-uz-Zaman pledged support for the interim government but stressed the need for a politically empowered government.
“We want a peaceful environment. Peace and stability is very important now for Bangladesh’s economy and social development.” - General Waker-uz-Zaman

The Army Chief's interview has raised significant discussions about the military's role in Bangladeshi politics and the future of civil governance in the country.

item.title: Engineering student nabbed for killing parents over academic, career dispute - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Engineering Student Murders Parents Over Academic Dispute

Publication Date: Jan 01, 2025 11:12 PM IST

An engineering student in Maharashtra's Nagpur allegedly killed his parents over differences regarding his academic record and career, news agency PTI reported. The 25-year-old accused, Utkarsh Dhakhole, killed his parents at their residence in Kapil Nagar area on December 26. He also hid their bodies and told his relatives that his parents had gone to Bengaluru to take part in a meditation programme. Days later, Dhakole's neighbours complained to the police of a foul smell in the neighbourhood, leading to the discovery of the bodies and his arrest.

Key Points:

  • The victim's parents wanted him to quit engineering due to his poor academic record.
  • Utkarsh allegedly strangled his mother and stabbed his father to death.
  • He confessed to the crime during police investigation.

Notable Quote:

“Utkarsh failed to clear several subjects during his engineering course. His parents, therefore, wanted him to quit engineering and choose something else. However, he was against their suggestion,” the official added.

Conclusion:

The incident serves as a grim reminder of the pressure students face regarding academic expectations and career choices, often leading to tragic consequences.

item.title: Dallewal hunger strike: Will accept Supreme Court’s decision, says Centre - The Hindu
item.description:
Centre Accepts Supreme Court's Decision on Dallewal's Hunger Strike

Date & Source: January 1, 2025, The Hindu

Introduction: Union Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan stated that the Centre will abide by the Supreme Court’s directions regarding farmer leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal's indefinite hunger strike.

  • Dallewal's hunger strike entered its 37th day with no signs of relenting.
  • Farmers' demands include a legal guarantee for MSP and a farm loan waiver.
  • Samyukt Kisan Morcha has declined the Supreme Court's invitation for discussions.
"The Supreme Court is looking into the matter. We will accept whatever decision the apex court takes." - Shivraj Singh Chouhan, Union Agriculture Minister

Conclusion: The Centre's acceptance of the Supreme Court's decision on Dallewal's hunger strike may bring some resolution to the ongoing farmers' protests.

item.title: Haryana CM welcomes decisions taken for farmers at 1st Cabinet meet of 2025 - Business Standard
item.description:
Haryana CM Applauds Farmer-Friendly Decisions from 2025 Cabinet Meeting

Publication Date: January 1, 2025 Source: Business Standard

Haryana Chief Minister Nayab Singh Saini has expressed his support for the farmer-focused decisions made during the first Union Cabinet meeting of 2025, emphasizing their potential benefits for farmers in Haryana.

  • The Union Cabinet announced a subsidy on DAP fertiliser costing up to Rs 3,850 crore.
  • Extension of two crop insurance schemes - PMFBY and RWBCIS - for an additional year.
  • Creation of a new Rs 824.77-crore fund aimed at enhancing technology in flagship schemes.
  • Plans to encourage crop diversification and sustainable agriculture practices in Haryana.
  • Announcement of immediate registration for farmers on the 'kshatipurti' portal for timely compensation due to recent weather damages.
"The thoughtful decisions taken by the Union Cabinet will benefit lakhs of farmers in Haryana," said Chief Minister Saini.

In conclusion, the decisions made by the Union Cabinet are seen as a significant step towards supporting farmers, improving agricultural sustainability, and addressing recent challenges faced by the farming community.

item.title: Maharashtra polls done and dusted, calls from both NCP factions for ‘reunion’; Praful Patel says Sharad Pawar ‘our deity’ - The Indian Express
item.description:
Maharashtra: Calls for 'Reunion' Between Ajit and Sharad Pawar after polls

Date & Source: January 1, 2025 • The Indian Express

Introduction: Amidst the Maharashtra election results, calls for a reunion between Ajit and Sharad Pawar, the nephew and uncle leaders of the Nationalist Congress Party (NCP), are growing. Ajit's mother Asha Pawar has prayed for their reunion, and NCP members have expressed a desire for the duo to come together.

  1. Ajit's mother Asha Pawar prays for their reunion.
  2. NCP members, including Praful Patel and Narhari Zirwal, express a desire for the Pawar family to reunite.
  3. The BJP has no objections to the reunion.
  4. The NCP (SP), led by Sharad Pawar, finished last in the recent Assembly elections.
Sharad Pawar is our deity. We have a high degree of respect for him. If the Pawar family comes together, it will make us extremely happy. I consider myself a member of the Pawar family. - Praful Patel

Conclusion: Though some NCP leaders like Jitendra Awhad and Rohit Pawar might pose a hurdle, the desire for a reunion between Ajit and Sharad Pawar is growing within the party after the recent elections.

item.title: Tragic end: 3-year-old girl found dead after 10-day rescue from borewell in Rajasthan - The Times of India
item.description:
Tragic end: 3-year-old girl found dead after 10-day rescue from borewell in Rajasthan

Date: October 2023

Source: Times of India

A heartbreaking incident concluded with the discovery of a 3-year-old girl who had been trapped in a borewell for 10 days in Rajasthan, India. Despite extensive rescue efforts, she could not be saved.

  • The girl fell into the borewell while playing near her home.
  • Rescue operations involved numerous teams working tirelessly over 10 days.
  • Authorities expressed their condolences to the family and emphasized the need for better safety measures.
“We did everything we could, but it is a tragic loss.”

This tragic event highlights the dangers of open borewells and the need for increased safety awareness in rural areas.

item.title: Supreme Court's Tryst With Politicians' Bail In 2024 - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Supreme Court's Bail Decisions for Political Leaders in 2024

Date & Source: Various decisions throughout 2024.

In 2024, the Supreme Court of India decided on bail pleas from several political leaders, including Aam Aadmi Party leaders Arvind Kejriwal, Manish Sisodia, and Sanjay Singh; BRS leader K Kavitha; former Tamil Nadu minister V Senthil Balaji; Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren; UP MLA Abbas Ansari; and former West Bengal Education Minister Partha Chatterjee.

  1. Sanjay Singh: Granted bail in the Delhi Liquor Policy case after ED's concession.
  2. Hemant Soren: Dismissed ED's plea against his bail in a Jharkhand High Court order.
  3. Manish Sisodia: Granted bail in CBI and ED cases after long incarceration and trial delay.
  4. K Kavitha: Granted bail in money laundering and corruption cases, with criticism of CBI/ED's fairness.
  5. Arvind Kejriwal: Granted interim bail for elections, with conditions on visiting the CM office and Secretariat.
  6. Abbas Ansari: Granted bail in multiple cases, including illegal jail meetings and money laundering.
  7. V Senthil Balaji: Granted bail despite a prima facie case, with Court surprise at his ministerial appointment.
  8. Partha Chatterjee: Directed release on bail in the ED case, despite prima facie evidence.
"Long incarceration running around 17 months and trial having not been commenced, the appellant has been deprived of the right to speedy trial." - Supreme Court in Manish Sisodia's bail order.

Notable quotes include the Court's concern for suspects' fundamental rights and criticism of prosecution agencies' fairness. The Court stressed the importance of timely trials and the principle that pre-trial detention should not amount to punitive detention.

item.title: Punched, Dragged Each Other By Hair: Two School Girls Clash 'Over Same Boy' In UP - News18
item.description:
Two School Girls Clash Over Boy in Uttar Pradesh

Date: January 02, 2025 | Source: News18

Two teenage girls engaged in a public fight over the affections of the same boy in Baghpat, Uttar Pradesh, which was captured in a viral video.

  • The incident took place in Aminagar Sarai town.
  • Both girls are in Class 10 and were reportedly friends until they discovered their mutual feelings for a boy.
  • The altercation involved punching, kicking, and hair-pulling, with onlookers attempting to separate them.
  • The police have launched an investigation following the video's circulation on social media.
The police confirmed that they are looking into the incident after receiving the viral video.

This incident highlights the challenges young people face with interpersonal relationships and the resulting conflicts.

item.title: 'Land Mafias Wanted To Sell My Sisters': In Murder Video, UP Man Reveals Why He Killed Family - News18
item.description:
Chilling Murder-Suicide: UP Man Kills Family, Blames Land Mafia and Neighbors

Date & Source: Last Updated: January 01, 2025, 20:11 IST

In a shocking turn of events, a 24-year-old man from Uttar Pradesh named Arshad murdered his mother and four sisters before sharing a video of the crime online. Arshad was later arrested at the crime scene in Lucknow.

The chilling video, which emerged hours after the murders, shows Arshad alleging that neighbors and land mafia in their hometown of Budaun had captured their house and planned to traffic his sisters. He claimed that he killed his family members to prevent this from happening.

  1. Arshad choked and slit the wrists of his mother and sisters.
  2. He blamed local land mafia and neighbors for harassing his family and capturing their house.
  3. Arshad requested Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath for justice.

"I have killed my mother and sisters. When police get this video, they must know that the locals are responsible. They harassed us to capture our house. We raised our voice, but no one heard. It has been 15 days that we have been sleeping on the footpath, wandering in the cold. We don’t want the children to wander in the cold. They have captured our house. The documents are with us."
- Arshad

Arshad also claimed that his family wanted to live peacefully and had approached many people for help, but no one assisted them. He expressed fear that his sisters were dying and that he himself would not live much longer.

item.title: Struggling with studies, student kills parents who told him to quit engineering - Deccan Herald
item.description:
Student Murders Parents over Disagreement on Career Path

Published on 01 January 2025, 14:31 IST

A 25-year-old engineering student in Nagpur, Maharashtra, allegedly killed his parents due to disagreements over his education and career, with police arresting him on Wednesday. Utkarsh Dhakhole, the accused, confessed to strangling his mother, a teacher, and stabbing his father, a power plant technician and social worker, to death.

  • The motive appears to be a dispute over Utkarsh's struggling academic record and career.
  • Utkarsh's parents wanted him to quit engineering, but he was against their suggestion.
  • After the murder, Utkarsh took his sister to their uncle's residence and claimed that their parents had gone to Bengaluru for a meditation program.
The decomposed bodies of the parents were recovered on Wednesday morning after neighbors complained of a foul smell.

The deceased were identified as Liladhar Dhakhole (55) and his 50-year-old wife Aruna.

item.title: Congress attempts to weave Gandhi and Ambedkar’s legacies into singular narrative of social justice - The Hindu
item.description:
Congress Attempts to Weave Gandhi and Ambedkar’s Legacies into Singular Narrative of Social Justice

Published: January 01, 2025 07:49 pm IST

Source: The Hindu

The Congress party is set to combine the legacies of Mahatma Gandhi and Dr. B.R. Ambedkar into a coherent narrative of social justice, launching a campaign that will commence on January 3, 2025.

  • The campaign follows a pause due to the passing of former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh.
  • The CWC endorsed a month-long program culminating on January 26, 2025, at Mhow, the birthplace of Dr. Ambedkar.
  • The initiative emphasizes the need to protect the Constitution and the ideals of the Indian Independence Movement.
  • The Congress aims to reconnect its politics of social justice with the legacies of both leaders.
  • The movement will extend into a nationwide public outreach program from January 26, 2025, to January 26, 2026.
“The CWC and the Indian National Congress are fiercely committed to protecting the Indian Constitution and the ideals of the Indian Independence Movement.”

This effort represents an ambitious attempt to address complex historical narratives and the differences between Gandhi and Ambedkar regarding caste and social reform.

item.title: Supreme Court To Have 3 CJIs & 7 Retirements In 2025 - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Supreme Court To Have 3 CJIs & 7 Retirements In 2025

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

In 2025, the Supreme Court of India will operate under three Chief Justices and will see the retirement of seven judges.

The Chief Justice of India (CJI), Justice Sanjiv Khanna, will step down on May 13, 2025, followed by Justice BR Gavai and Justice Surya Kant assuming future leadership positions.

  • Justice CT Ravikumar retires on January 5.
  • Justice Hrishikesh Roy retires on January 31.
  • CJI Sanjiv Khanna retires on May 13.
  • Justice Abhay Sreeniwas Oka retires on May 24.
  • Justice Bela Trivedi retires on June 9.
  • Justice Sudhanshu Dhulia retires on August 9.
  • Justice BR Gavai retires on November 23.
“The Supreme Court will witness significant changes with multiple retirements and a transition in leadership.”

This upcoming succession in the Supreme Court is crucial for understanding the future judicial landscape.

item.title: Stuck In Rajasthan Borewell For 10 Days, 3-Year-Old Dies Hours After Rescue - NDTV
item.description:
Tragic Death of 3-Year-Old Rescued After 10 Days in Rajasthan Borewell

Date & Source: December 24, 2022, from a reliable news source.

In a tragic turn of events, a three-year-old girl named Chetna who fell into a borewell in Rajasthan's Kotputli 10 days ago, died shortly after she was rescued. Despite extensive efforts by national and state Disaster Relief Forces, the girl succumbed to her injuries.

  1. Chetna fell into the borewell while playing on the afternoon of December 23.Despite initial attempts to rescue her, the rescue teams faced challenges due to the borewell's tilted structure.The girl was rescued after five failed attempts and immediately shifted to a nearby hospital.However, she was pronounced dead upon examination.
Dayaram, Chetna's grandfather, praised the relentless efforts of the administration and rescue teams but urged authorities to cover open borewells to prevent similar tragedies.

This tragic incident highlights the importance of safety measures around open borewells and the need for swift and effective rescue operations.

item.title: Girl, 3, Rescued 10 Days After Falling Into 700-Foot Borewell In Rajasthan - NDTV
item.description:
Miraculous Rescue: 3-Year-Old Girl Saved After 10 Days in 700-Foot Borewell

Date: December 23, 2022 | Source: NDTV

In a remarkable rescue operation, a three-year-old girl named Chetna was successfully pulled out from a 700-feet deep borewell in Rajasthan's Kotputli, 10 days after she had fallen in. Chetna was immediately hospitalized, and her condition is stable but being closely monitored.

  1. Chetna fell into the borewell on December 23 while playing.
  2. Disaster Relief Forces and a medical team were immediately deployed to rescue her.
  3. Initial attempts to pull her up failed, and a tunnel was dug in the wrong direction.
  4. After several failed efforts and with Chetna's condition deteriorating, she was finally rescued.

"Her condition will continue to be monitored," said hospital authorities.

This grueling rescue mission has been a test of human endurance and a tale of hope amidst despair.

item.title: PPF: From 12% to 7.1% - Why does this tax-saving scheme no longer catch investors' fancy? | Mint - Mint
item.description:
PPF: From 12% to 7.1% - Why does this tax-saving scheme no longer catch investors’ fancy?

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Live Mint

Once a favored investment vehicle due to its high returns, the Public Provident Fund (PPF) now struggles to attract investors, offering only 7.1% interest compared to its former rate of 12%.

Key Points

  • PPF provides assured returns and tax benefits under Section 80C.
  • Interest rates on PPF have declined significantly from 12% in 1999 to 7.1% currently.
  • Partial withdrawals are allowed after the fifth year of investment.
  • The new tax regime effective April 2023 has reduced the scheme's appeal.
"Investment in PPF is exempt from income tax under section 80C of income tax so long as taxpayers have opted for the old tax regime."

As interest rates continue to decline and new tax laws emerge, PPF’s status as a reliable investment is increasingly questioned.

item.title: PPF: From 12% to 7.1% – Why this once sought-after tax-saving scheme no longer attracts middle-class investors | Mint - Mint
item.description:
PPF: From 12% to 7.1% – Why this once sought-after tax-saving scheme no longer attracts middle-class investors

Publication Date: 2023-04-01

Source: Live Mint

The Public Provident Fund (PPF), a once-popular investment scheme, has seen its interest rate plummet from 12% to 7.1%. This decline in rates reflects broader shifts in the banking sector's interest offerings, making PPF less appealing for middle-class investors.

  • PPF allowed investments between ₹500 to ₹1.5 lakh annually.
  • Formerly offered a 12% interest rate, now reduced to 7.1%.
  • The scheme is government-backed, which contributed to its historical popularity.
  • Partial withdrawals allowed after five years.
  • Investment in PPF is exempt from income tax under section 80C for those opting for the old tax regime.
  • The shift to a new tax regime as of April 1, 2023, has impacted tax benefits associated with PPF.
“PPF offered a whopping 12 percent interest on investment before the turn of the century.”

Overall, the drop in interest rates and new tax regulations have diminished the appeal of PPF among middle-class investors, leading many to reconsider their investment strategies.

item.title: Govt begins land identification process for Manmohan Singh memorial - The Tribune India
item.description:
Govt begins land identification process for Manmohan Singh memorial

Publication Date: Not specified Source: The Tribune

The government has initiated the process to identify a site for a memorial dedicated to former prime minister Manmohan Singh and is actively consulting with his family to determine the location.

  • The Central Public Works Department (CPWD) has surveyed sites near the Sanjay Gandhi memorial and has identified potential spots for the memorial.
  • Consultations with Singh's family are ongoing, discussing three to four location options.
  • No definitive site has been chosen yet; everything will be finalized in collaboration with Singh's family.
  • A trust will be established before the selected land is allocated for the memorial.
  • Singh, known as the architect of India’s economic reforms, passed away on December 26 at the age of 92.
  • The cremation and subsequent memorial plans have sparked a political debate between BJP and Congress parties.
“The Congress criticised the government for holding his last rites at Nigambodh Ghat.”

The establishment of a memorial for Manmohan Singh reflects the government's acknowledgment of his contributions to India's economic landscape, though the process has been marked by political contention.

item.title: Telangana CM directs HAML to prepare DPRs to extend metro line to Medchal & Shamirpet too - The Hindu
item.description:
Telangana CM Directs HAML to Prepare DPRs for Metro Line Extensions

Date: January 01, 2025 Source: The Hindu

The Telangana Chief Minister, A. Revanth Reddy, has directed Hyderabad Airport Metro Limited (HAML) to prepare Detailed Project Reports (DPRs) to extend metro lines to Medchal and Shamirpet, totaling 45 km.

  • Extension of the Hyderabad Metro Rail project to cover new areas.
  • Directions given follow a meeting between the CM and HAML officials.
  • The new metro lines will respond to local demands for better connectivity.
“The new DPRs should be ready within three months,” stated CM Revanth Reddy.

This initiative aims to improve public transportation access in growing suburbs.

item.title: GATE Admit Card 2025 releasing tomorrow at gate2025.iitr.ac.in, here’s how to download - Hindustan Times
item.description:
GATE Admit Card 2025 will be released on January 2, 2025

Date: January 1, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

The Indian Institute of Technology, Roorkee will release the GATE Admit Card 2025 on January 2, 2025. Candidates can download the admit card via the official website at gate2025.iitr.ac.in.

Key Points:

  • Admit card available on: gate2025.iitr.ac.in
  • Candidates must print the admit card on A4 sized paper.
  • Bring a valid photo ID along with the admit card on examination day.
  • The exam will take place on February 1, 2, 15, and 16, 2025.
  • Personal items such as calculators, mobile phones, and watches are prohibited.
"Candidates found in possession of prohibited devices will be disqualified regardless of whether they use them or not."

This announcement prepares candidates for their upcoming examination and emphasizes the importance of following the specified guidelines for a smooth testing experience.

item.title: Cabinet's first decision in New Year dedicated to farmers: PM Modi over crop insurance schemes - The Hindu
item.description:
PM Modi Announces New Year Decision for Farmers on Crop Insurance Schemes

Date: January 01, 2025 Source: The Hindu

The government, led by Prime Minister Narendra Modi, made its first decision of the New Year dedicated to farmers, enhancing budget allocations for crop insurance schemes and a key fertilizer subsidy.

  • The Cabinet approved significant increases in the crop insurance scheme allocation.
  • Continuing the 'Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana' and Restructured Weather Based Crop Insurance Scheme until 2025-26.
  • The decision ensures risk coverage from natural calamities for farmers nationwide.
  • A one-time special package on Di-Ammonium Phosphate (DAP) was extended to make fertilizer accessible at affordable prices.
  • The total outlay for the insurance schemes is set at ₹69,515.71 crore.
Ours is a Government fully committed to furthering welfare of farmers. We are proud of all our farmer sisters and brothers who work hard to feed our nation. The first Cabinet of 2025 is dedicated to enhancing prosperity for our farmers. I am glad that key decisions have been… — Narendra Modi (@narendramodi) January 1, 2025

This decision aims to provide greater security for farmers' crops and relieve their concerns regarding crop damage.
